structure.unit: B ADMISSION OF AN INDIVIDUAL WITH AN INTELLECTUAL DISABILITY

law.catch_line: Petition for writ of habeas corpus.
law.text: At any time, and without notice, a person detained at a facility, or a relative, friend, guardian, representative, or attorney on behalf of such person, may petition for a writ of habeas corpus to question the cause and legality of the detention and request that the Circuit Court issue a writ for release.
law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 147, sec. 25, effective July 13, 1990.
